result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:55 PM Defendant Kenneth J Knotek in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Kenneth J Knotek.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Case dismissed and read in to 22CM605.

10/20/22:  Court ordered cash bond reduced from $500.00 to $200.00.  Defendant has not posted any monies and still needs to post $200.00.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no violent contact with Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

9:36 AM Defendant Kenneth J Knotek in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Kenneth J Knotek.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for bail/bond hearing in 22CM1792.
Arguments by the Defense.
Arguments by the State.
Statement by Witness A.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court orders the cash bond reduced from $500.00 to $200.00.  Court orders the conditions of the bond amended to: No violent contact with Witness A.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bail/bond hearing on October 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:59 PM Defendant Kenneth J Knotek in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.
